intro: Merremia kimberleyensis, commonly known as Kimberley morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces violet to blue flowers that open in the morning and close in the evening. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a velvety texture. Merremia kimberleyensis is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soils.
